lines.text: Nanny? What are you, some sort of baby?
She takes care of my mom, she used to take care of me and my sister Susie, until Susie was killed.
They blamed me and they sent me away to that place.
I don't want to be moved out of this room.
I'll have to talk to your father about that.
If you tell him, I'll do something!
You said she tried to kill you.
That's right, just like she killed Susie.
I'm taking Master Joey an extra pillow... what are you doing up so late?
I couldn't sleep, I'm going to make a cup of tea.
It's bad for you this late at night... you go back to bed and I'll bring you a glass of milk.
I don't want a glass of milk, I want a cup of tea.
Nanny, don't take Joey that pillow... he'll never go back to sleep.
[leaves the room and reenters a few seconds later]
You don't approve of pillows, I remember you saying when we were small 'children shouldn't have pillows'. What was that word you used? Overlay, they might overlay themselves. Suffocate.
Master Joey is not a baby.
I'm sure I don't know what you're talking about.
You went into the bathroom, even after Joey made you swear you wouldn't.
You lie, it's all been lies, hasn't it? You poisoned Virgie, it wasn't Joey at all.
It's an X-ray machine, don't touch it, it's dangerous.
I don't know, but Daddy says if you get overexposed you can die.
That would be great, bring her up here, put her on the couch...
And overexpose her would serve her right.
I can make a hangman's knot.
Can I sleep with you tonight?
What happens if you die in the night? You told Mommy you could drop down dead at any time.
Only if I excite or exert myself, and I don't plan to do either.
Yes, she had traumatic fever as a baby. Left her with a weak heart.
You mean if she got scared or something, she could just fall down dead?
Who? If you mean Nanny, say so, is that who you mean?
No, she's as healthy as a horse.
The bottle was under your pillow.
Cross my heart and hope to die.
You probably will, they'll hang you.
No, but she's eaten something and we've got to pump it out of her tummy, what was it Joey? What was it, Joey?
, she's the one who cooked the supper.
No, *really* balmy, know what she did when she found Susy?

[flashback, finding Susy in the tub]
There you are, I've been looking all over for you.
She bathed her, she had all her clothes on, she was DEAD, and she bathed her, and she talked to her while she was doing it, as if it were all normal.
Yes, only I wouldn't let her. I wouldn't eat incase she poisoned me, I wouldn't sleep incase she came in and smothered me. I wouldn't do anything.
Of course I told them, she told them too, she said that Susy and I were playing boats in the bath, and I pushed hers in, ran away and hid.
I won't! I won't stay here with her, and if you try to make me stay here with her, alone, I'll run away.
Sit down on the couch madam, I wish to examine you.
Oh Doctor, do you think I ought?
You said you wouldn't go into the bathroom, he made you swear!
It's ALL been lies, hasn't it? Now give me that pillow.
I'll get you something to wear.
I'm not going to wear any girl's clothes!
I'll get you some of my father's.
What was so bad about Mrs. Griggs?
I've been with her for the past 14 hours, watching her die.
Why didn't you phone me sooner?
She didn't tell me until she knew she was dying. Told me she thought she had a chance of pulling through, she just didn't want to see you. Want me to make the arrangements?
I'm asking if you want her properly taken care of.
Yes, well it's about 25 years too late, isn't it? You were too busy looking after other people's children, not enough time to spare for your own.
No she can't help you, she's dead. She was pregnant you know.

Yeah, and not much chance of looking after the child, she couldn't bear the thought of bringing up an illegitimate baby the way she was brought up. Better get rid of it. This isn't a very *choice* neighborhood but they do know how to look after themselves in a pinch. And for what? Oh 5 or 10 pounds you can buy yourself an abortion. He left her on the doorstep to bleed to death. I take it you know something about medicine, would you like to hear the details?

Why not? She's your flesh and blood, don't you want to hear how she died? Not exactly in the high street class these backstreet abortionists, they want their money first before they get to work and they're not very fussy about sterilization, some of them don't even bother to wash their hands first! And they don't care where they do it either.
